thread.title: Season champion Zarco wins Moto2 Japan GP
thread.title_full: Season champion Zarco wins Moto2 Japan GP - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Season champion Zarco wins Moto2 Japan GP
text:
MOTEGI: Frenchman Johann Zarco took his seventh victory of the season in the Moto2 category of the Japan Grand Prix Sunday, keeping command of the field even after he had secured the season title.
The pole starter clocked 31 minutes 17.900 seconds to finish the 15-lap race, 4.505 seconds faster than Jonas Folger and 15.433 seconds ahead of Sandro Cortese.
Zarco became the Moto2 world champion when when his closest rival Tito Rabat pulled with an injury on Friday.
Rabat had to abandon the Japanese race during the first free practice session Friday morning citing pain from a broken left radius in his forearm, sustained in a training crash on Monday.
The race in Motegi was reduced from the 23 laps originally scheduled due to rain and fog that caused a two-hour delay of warm-up sessions in mountainous Motegi.
